boardgame.name: Dog Park
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Dog Park, a mid-weight, competitive set-collection and point-to-point movement game in which players take on the role of dog walkers who recruit, walk, and care for their dogs over four rounds. Each round is split into four phases:


Recruitment Phase: Players compete in two rounds of offers to add dogs to their kennels. Offers are made with players' reputation (victory points), so must be placed wisely.
Selection Phase: Players decide which dogs to place on their lead to walk this round.
Walking Phase: Players journey through the dog park with their fellow walkers, collecting resources, earning reputation, and interacting with other walkers.
Home Time Phase: Players earn reputation for their walked dogs, and lose reputation for any unwalked dogs in their kennel.


Players must choose their routes and dogs carefully to earn the best reputation and prove they are the most accomplished walker of them all. At the end of the game, the player with the most reputation wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Plunder Busters
boardgame.description:
Plunder Busters is a board game for 3-4 players, where each player takes the role of a budding archaeologist trying to achieve glory in their field. They will do this by exploring new excavation sites, digging up artefacts and researching new relics.

In Phase 1 (Build your Dig Site!), players will place tiles on their Dig Site board in secret before embarking on Phase 2 (Plunder!); where players will explore each others’ Dig Sites, attempting to claim Relics and Artefacts whilst avoiding the Traps set by the other players.

Players will earn Reputation by uncovering tiles which contain Artefacts (worth 1, 2 or 3 points), or prized Relics (worth 4+ points); the locations of which are indicated by 'clue' cards that players will compete to collect. However, following false leads and uncovering a Trap tile will cause a player to lose Reputation (-5 points) at the hands of devious opponents. The adventurer with the highest Reputation when the available clue cards have been exhausted will win the game!

The game begins as a tile-laying/’build your own board’ adventure, before shifting to an exploration of your opponents’ dig sites: through the cunning use of action cards and a quest to find hidden Relics, only the most successful adventurer will prevail!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Filler: Play Mat
boardgame.description: A 15" x 10" neoprene play mat for the card game Filler.

boardgame.name: Tenacious Tupilaq
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Contains one creature inspired by Inuit mythology, 4 tables with randomized body parts and at least one mention of heresy.

boardgame.name: The Black Volga
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

THE BLACK VOLGA - MÖRK BORGified Polish urban legend about the fearsome vehicle driven by former regime's secret service, satanists or the Satan himself - presented to you as the ready-to-use urban encounter with pursuit rules and skirmish with the Black Volga's (current) owner.

boardgame.name: Tilty
boardgame.description:
The objective of the game is to add items to Tilty the clown without having him tip.

Before playing, assemble Tilty the clown and put him in the middle of the table. The first player spins the spinner and chooses an object of the color he/she spun and places it either on Tilty or one of the three trays he is balancing. Only one hand may be used to perform this action and Tilty cannot be touched.

When a player tries to place an object on Tilty and it or others fall off, that player is eliminated. The objects that fell are put back into play. The last player left is the winner.

boardgame.name: Breakaway: The Anti-Violence Anti-Aggression Anti-Anger Anti-Abuse Game
boardgame.description:
This is an educational game to teach adolescents about abuse and nonviolent ways to handle anger.

Players go around a circular track landing on either Breakaway or Aggression spaces.

The first to reach the top of the freedom path wins.

boardgame.name: Viking Raiders Card Game
boardgame.description:
Viking Raiders is a 2-5 player card game, where players are Viking chiefs, jostling to build the biggest Navy, create the largest Clan and gain the most Loot.

On your turn, you draw 2 cards to see what your clan has been up to whilst you have been away 'chiefing'. Have they focused on resources and mined stone or gold, collected wood, created new vikings, or built up the food supplies? Sometimes they have spent their time preparing actions for you by capturing a wandering Berserker or preparing for a raid (one of their favourite endeavours). Or maybe they have gained a favour from one of the Norse gods or goddesses?

Each turn you may use one action (for example go on a raid or use a favour from a God or Goddess) and buy one item from a central Market. You buy items using resources in your hand, and you can choose between ships for your Navy, buildings for your Clan and valuables for your Loot. Each item gives 1-3 Victory Points, and the first player to have an agreed number of Victory Points in each category wins the game.

There are also four rare Abilities that sometimes turn up in the Market. Oh, and watch out for Ragnarok...!

Compact and travel friendly, this gateway game is ideal for casual gamers and families with children aged 9 or above.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Beyblade Burst Rise Hypersphere Vertical Drop Battle Set
boardgame.description:
Drop in to victory with Beyblade Burst Rise Hypersphere tech! Hypersphere Vertical Drop Beystadium consists of 3 sections specially designed for exciting Beyblade Burst battles. Climb the vertical wall of the Beystadium to reach the brink and gain an edge over your contenders. Then, speed along the brink and drop in to the battle ring for head-to-head collisions. Get the drop on your opponents for exciting, high-intensity battles!

Includes everything needed to battle: Beyblade Burst Hypersphere Vertical Drop Beystadium, 2 right/left-spin Beyblade Burst launchers and 2 Hypersphere battling tops with GT Chips.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Monumentus
boardgame.description:
Monumentus is a two to four player combination territory control and resource management game played on triangular tiles, with the ability to expand to 5-8 players. Roleplaying as the mangers of a civilization, players make progress across an advancement track split into four eras of time, with each era requiring a player to construct four unique buildings which either produce resources, create an engine to produce new resources, or effect the way in which those resources are managed.

At the beginning of the game, each player is given eight terrain tiles, two of which are placed at the start of the game. As each player advances to the next era, they place two new terrain tiles creating a sort of "fog of war". Over the course of gameplay each player will place 16 buildings before constructing the final monument, winning the game for that player.

In addition to the placement of buildings, each turn players draw either a "rise" or a "ruin" card depending on their leaderboard position. These cards have random effects which balance gameplay for those who are lagging behind or have snowballed ahead, which can be omitted for purely strategic gameplay. As well, players move up to two merchant pieces with the ability to duplicate the production of the building or resource triangle they are standing on, including the buildings of their opponents.

At the end of each round, players collectively take part in open trade where they are able to trade: resources, constructed buildings, rise cards, their status tokens, and can make promissory agreements for future payment which they are not required to fulfil. The game is played until the first player constructs their monument, which determines the winner of that game. The game can be continued to determined second, third, place players if desired.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cold War 3! Rules for Modern Warfare 1960-1990: 4th Edition
boardgame.description:
Fully revised 4th Edition of COLD WAR3!

Includes:

Rules for combined arms using artillery, armour, mechanised, aircraft and support troops (such as engineers and medical personnel).
Rules for the electronic battlefield, nuclear, biological & chemical battlefield.
Recovering and repairing 'knocked out' vehicles; building bridges, defenses, trenches and repairing defenses.
Fighting in buildings, built up areas and in a contaminated environment.
Rules for paratroopers, reconnaissance elements, assaults and close-combat (even assaulting tanks if you are so inclined).
Rules for conducting air support missions, air-to-air combat, air-to-ground attacks, helicopter operations, anti-aircraft artillery and missiles.
Rules are also included for morale and their effect on our little model soldiers. Wounds and recovery of those (using medics if you've paid for them!)
Rules for various armours such as Chobham, Dorchester, ERA bricks, BAR armour and all manner of nasties thsat can defeat those armours including 2nd generation (Top-Attack.Tandem Warhead) ATGM's such as Improved TOW II and the Russian Svir missiles.
This new version includes the following New TO&E's:
A complete BAOR (British Army of the Rhine)/NORTHTAG battlegroup for the 14th/20th Royal Hussars and Royal Green Jackets; including Chieftain Mk.V Tanks, Fv432 APC, Abbot and M-109 Self-Propelled Guns, RAMC Medical Teams, 9th/12th Lancers Reccee Teams (in Scorpion AFV), Swingfire ATGM, Blowpipe and Rapier SAM and 661st Squadron Army Air Corps in Lynx HELARM and the Royal Air Force with shiny Harrier GR.III and Lightning Ground Attack Aircraft.
Soviet Forces: 3rd Shock Armies 10th Guards Armoured Divisions: with T80u and T-64bv tanks, BMP-1 and BMP-2 APC's, BTR-70's and of course a whole plethora of artillery such as the BM-21, BM-27, 2s1 and 2s3 artillery, anti-aircraft artillery such as the Tunguska, ZSU-23-4 and the ZSU-23-2 AA guns, the Soviet Air Force flying Su-25 Frogfoots and even Mil-Mi-8 Hip attack helicopters!



Also includes all new color photographs and illustrations.

-description from publisher

Cold War 3! Gulf States: Gulf Wars – Saudi Arabia, Bahrain, UAE, Jordan & Oman

boardgame.name: Aegis (Issue 1 - 2019)
boardgame.description:
Aegis

Aegis en un e-zine sin ánimo de lucro creado por y para aficionados de Ars Magica.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Delight
boardgame.description:
Two consenting adult players will compete to be the first to enter the Danger Zone... err... make that "the Delight Zone" at the center of the game board, where the roll of a dice will determine which of 11 scenarios will be enacted (with the winner in charge of the ensuing role-played action). Costumes are optional but highly recommended per the scenario booklet. Especially if you get the alien encounter scenario.

Along the way to the center, various diverting tasks must be performed as you roll the dice and land on squares that give you things to do, including a moment where you stop and "select a new first and last name" to use later during role play. I suggest using "Richard Nixon", but mileage may vary.

Bonus points - this adult board game for partners includes some screamingly bad/unintentionally funny artwork, but clearly was a labor of someone's love. Good luck finding a copy (or wanting to)!

boardgame.name: Breakout! (Issue 10 - 1983)
boardgame.description:
Breakout!

Volume 3, Number 2

June-August 1983
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The 1983 Role-Playing Modules & Artwork Design Competition
Mass Combat in Science Fiction Role-Playing Games
So You Want to Play by Mail?

boardgame.name: LOTS: Filled In
boardgame.description:
The crew is back on the site. New codes have forced the developers to scrap the original blueprints. It's up to you to redesign the next tower that will define the city's skyline.

LOTS: Filled In is a roll and write game using "draft crafting". Players will use a snake draft to gain dice. Once all players have drafted their second die, they will choose 1 die to use for its shape and the other for its color. This will "craft" a block of their choosing. All players will add their block to their tower by coloring in the spaces on their sheet.

Through clever placement they will attempt to score points 4 different ways. Once a player can not legally place the block they crafted, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Agrarian
boardgame.description:
Agrarian is an economic farming game in which farmers go through a land bidding phase and then followed by a growing stage. During the bidding phase, different parcels of land will come up for auction in which all the farmers will put in a blind bid on each parcel of land. The highest bid gets the land.

During the second phase, farmers get a weather prediction and then have to decide what crops to grow. The more of one crop the group as a whole grows the less valuable it becomes. Weather also affects each crop differently. Once farmers decide what crops they are growing, the weather is decided by a dice roll that affects all farmers equally. Then crops are revealed and the value of the crops are adjusted based on the number of fields grown.

Farmers collect the amount of money they have made for each crop and then start the second round. 3 rounds later the game ends and the farmer with the most money wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Dice in the Darkness
boardgame.description:
Your dog has been taken captive deep into the dungeon by a mysterious creature. Fight your way through the ten rooms to save your dog and defeat the monster that is stealing joy from so many.

Dice in the Darkness is an episodic roll-and-write adventure played over ten rooms. You choose a character, Wizard, Warrior, or Rogue, and play that character through this ten room dungeon, upgrading and unlocking new abilities, with each room being a unique, one page roll-and-write experience.

It will be a free play-along-adventure, with each new room premiering via Twitch each week for ten weeks. Grab your pen, paper, and dice and survive the dungeon to save your beloved dog!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Beyblade Burst Rise: HyperSphere Dual Pack
boardgame.description:
Dual packs of Beyblade tops under the HyperSphere System.

Each Pack comes with one three layer top, and one 4 layer top.

boardgame.name: Harvest Moon: One World – Interior Design & Tool Upgrade Pack
boardgame.description: The Interior Design & Tool Upgrade Pack comes with five interior designs, as well as upgrades for the hoe, watering can, hammer, ax, and fishing rod to help make growing crops, fishing, and mining easier. The interior designs include farm, castle, steampunk, spaceship, and starlight.

boardgame.name: Harvest Moon: One World – Far East Adventure Pack
boardgame.description: Play though an entire new chapter in the game as you explore the exotic land of Wagashi. Woo a new bachelor and bachelorette: the stoic Shogen and the cheery Sana. Plant new crops like rice, chop down bamboo trees and meet some amazing new animals!

boardgame.name: Harvest Moon: One World – Precious Pets Pack
boardgame.description: The Precious Pets Pack brings 12 unique animals to the world of Harvest Moon: One World, including Siamese cats and silver dapple horses.

boardgame.name: Harvest Moon: One World – Mythical Wild Animals Pack
boardgame.description: Finally, the Mythical Wild Animals Pack introduces chocolate mint tigers, lava rabbits, and eight other fanciful wild animals for players to unlock.

boardgame.name: The Crocodile Hunter: Picture Pairing Game
Wetmore Forest: Picture Pairing Game
boardgame.description:
Use your memory and search the forest for monsters that match the pictures on the cards. But be careful - if you draw a Scramble card, all the monsters will find new hiding spots!

On each player's turn, they turn over two tokens and try to match the creatures to any of the three cards available that turn. If they get a match, they take both the token and the card, then reveal more cards until there are three creature cards. If a Scramble card is draw, the tokens are randomized and play resumes as normal. Whoever gets the most tokens and cards wins the game!

boardgame.name: Pitch&Plakks: Battle Mode expansion
boardgame.description:
Pitch&Plakks: Battle Mode expansion adds four new components and the ability to play one-on-one simultaneous games via the Triple. Can be played as a standalone version (using the same rules as the basic game) or with the basic game.

In Battle Mode, both players start at the same time. The player nearest the hole, plays again. Then players alternate until one reaches the hole.

New components added:


1x Triple (for Battle Mode)
1x Volcano
1x Bridge
1x Jump

boardgame.description:
Ianua Mystica
Issue 6
March 2013

boardgame.name: Ianua Mystica (Issue 5 - Jan 2013)
boardgame.description:
Ianua Mystica
Issue 5
January 2013

boardgame.name: Open Basic: Retro d100 Roleplaying
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

As the name suggests, this is a no frills set of roleplaying rules. These rules have been designed with an eye toward achieving fidelity to one particular d100 rule set that was released in 1980, insofar as open licenses will allow. Having said that, some changes have been made in accordance with the designer’s personal preferences.

These rules assume a basic familiarity with roleplaying games and dispense with drawn out discussions of what a roleplaying game is, what the roles of various players are, and so on. Such sacrifices were made for the sake of brevity, although future iterations of these rules may revisit such topics.

boardgame.name: Skylanders Ring of Heroes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Skylands. A wonderous world filled with magic and adventure. An endless expanse of clouds and fantastic floating islands. At the center of the world sits the Core of Light, which keeps darkness at bay and peace within Skylands. Only when the Core of Light fails to function, darkness creeps in to engulf Skylands. In Skylands, countless minions of the darkness and the Dark Portal Master himself, Kaos, battle for control against the Skylanders, guardians of the sky world. Most of the time, Master Eon and the Skylanders are able to maintain peace, but Kaos is always looking for ways to enact his devious plans. This time, Kaos has got his hands on the Book of Dark Magic. He plans to use this powerful spell book to manipulate all existing portals, isolate Skylands and become the sole ruler. But Kaos’ plans backfire! The portals start erupting one by one, and soon create a huge space explosion, so powerful that it causes a rift between dimensions! The rift starts pulling in entities from all corners of space, including things that don’t belong… And with it, the Portal Masters from Earth are suddenly transported into Skylands!

boardgame.name: Sharded
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sharded RPG is a fantasy role playing game set in the Sharded multiverse. The Sharded multiverse is divided into a multitude of different Shards, as varied as can possibly be imagined.

Each shard is its own self-contained universe, however, there are many different ways to jump between shards. Some people are able to do it at will, others are carried away in a dimensional rift and still others use science or magic to create portals between the shards.

In such a world, adventure is easy to find and many people spend their lives caught up in it.

boardgame.name: Star Travelers: The Game
boardgame.description:
A full rework of the original Star Travelers game, including a new starting board, more player interactivity, and less space punishment!

Players begin the game with a pass-draft to recruit crew members and upgraded ship parts. You will then set out into space in one of twelve directions, revealing tiles by using your ship's radar to discover planets, face aliens, and encounter random events along the way. Throughout the game, your actions will earn you rank marks that will determine the winner. Played on a modular board that is built as you play, Star Travelers combines classic mechanics with modern, modular components to keep game play fresh every time you play. Based on the sci-fi book series by author K. E. Knights.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Parídíne Narrator Tome
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Paridine is a deadly gritty game. Players may die in very unheroic ways. That is the way its meant to be.

User summary:

Parídíne focuses primarily on tactical combat and mechanical methods for creating situations and adventures. Roleplaying elements are pervasive but not prominent.

boardgame.name: Parídíne Players Tome
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Parídíne is a "free to play" fantasy combat game that was designed to keep combat and dungeon exploration exciting, fun and competitive. The idea and concept was to take as much control away from the "Dungeon Master" as possible. This doesn't mean the game doesn't require some kind of a narrator; It just means that the game is automated enough to draw out its own story-line using its own mechanics. The game is intended for 3-4 players not including the Narrator.

User summary:

Parídíne focuses primarily on tactical combat and mechanical methods for creating situations and adventures. Roleplaying elements are pervasive but not prominent.

boardgame.name: Quick Play Rules
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The narrator will setup a quest, mission or bounty, and give you the background story of what needs to be done by your party. Some Narrators may just throw you in a dungeon and slay random monsters.

User summary:

The Quick Play Rules do not present sufficient rules to play the game - they are intended more for use as a play reference.

boardgame.name: Parídíne Battle Board & Character Sheet
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The battle-board is where all the action takes place. It's designed to assist in the random events that take place in the game. You can use...any generic brand battle mat as long as you can fit the dimensions of the required guides on the mat.

User summary:

The battle-board is a 1-page PDF document that shows the suggested layout of a battle mat; it is not intended for use during play. The suggested battle mat dimensions are 32" x 32" divided into a grid of one-inch squares.

The character sheet is a 2-page PDF document.

boardgame.name: Truly Nature's Ally: New Archetypes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to issue ninety of the Player Paraphernalia series, short supplements designed to offer players new options for use with the Pathfinder RolePlaying Game. This issue introduces several new archetypes revolving around the diminished or complete loss of spell-casting abilities for the druid, hunter, and ranger. Originally a question posed on a facebook group site, it seemed like a good test in game theory and mechanics.

boardgame.name: D12 the Metagamers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Twelve people at a small town diner are given the ability to merge with aspects of their favorite games to play the ultimate game. The catch. Our dimension is on the line. If they lose our Earth will be the twelfth Earth dimension to fall.

Here are the G-Core stats and a short description of most of the heroes. Take a look at this for free, and see what think. Do you like it? Then check out the comic.

boardgame.name: Corpsewake Cove
boardgame.description:
Publisher summary

Corpsewake Cove is an adventure written for the MÖRK BORG game (under their Third Party License) where you FIGHT PIRATES, GET REVENGE, and STEAL THEIR F------- TREASURE!

boardgame.name: Heroic Archivist
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Heroic Archivist is an rpg that you play by reading, rating, and reviewing other rpgs.

Increase your Archivist Levels, earn Reality Medals, and strive to obtain a Promotional Pan Pizza in your service to the Great Library Of Alexandria.
