boardgame.name: Shade Harvest
boardgame.description: An Open source unlicensed game similar to Blue Orange Games - Photosynthesis. Can play online: http://chriscarr.name/grow/

boardgame.name: Tome: The Light Edition
boardgame.description:
Scattered all about the world, ancient books lie hidden in plain sight. Contained within these mystic Tomes is said to be the arcane secrets of life, power, and the very forces of nature. It is said that whoever finds these Tomes, can control magic itself.

Classic trick taking action, with a magical twist! Tome is a fresh take on the age old genre. In the normal mode, 4 players are split into 2 teams where teammates sit across from one another. Teams compete for points each chapter (trick) by playing 1 spell (card) to see who can win victory for their team. 3-4 Players can also square off against one another in survival mode, to see who is tough enough to be the last one standing.

Trump is not stagnate each round, but constantly changing each chapter. After each player is dealt 6 spells, the remaining spells are set in the center to form the Element Deck. Each chapter, a Title Spell is revealed from the top of the Element deck. The Element of the Title Spell determines what Element is trump for that chapter.

Each spell has a unique effect that can be used to shift the game in your favor. Weakening your opponents spells, powering up your own, or even changing trump! In order to gain the true power of a spell rules must be followed. Following suit is not required in Tome, a player can play any spell from their hand on their turn. When the lead player plays a spell, they begin a Chain in that Element. The next player can play a spell of the same Element to continue the chain and gain the effect of their spell. If a player plays a spell with a different Element, the Chain is broken and their spell is silenced and has no effect.

Within the Tome deck there are also spells of a Special Element. These spells all share a similar property. They do not start nor break a Chain, and their magic cannot be silenced. However there is a trade off: A special spell cannot be trump.

In survival mode, each player is on their own. Players begin a round with 2 health, then the player who plays the weakest spell each chapter loses a health. When a players health reaches 0, they are out of the round and each surviving player score a points.

Tome is built to be a modular game. Switching in different Elements changes up the strategy, and will ensure each game is fresh and exciting!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Cardboard Time Episode 12 (With Lauren Yu): Root, Steam Up, Poetry for Neanderthals
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Tome: The Light Edition – The Gold Codex

boardgame.name: Ancient Stories: Gods of Egypt
boardgame.description:
Stop the wicked schemes of an evil pharaoh before your city is annihilated in this heart-stopping match-three adventure! When the vile Tutmos sets in motion his plan to achieve immortality by reciting an incantation that unleashes a deadly plague, you must save your people by destroying the unholy altars that are sustaining the pharaoh's spell.

As the hero of this captivating tale, you must create chains of three or more matching elements to clear the levels that stand between you and the altars. Along the way, you'll unleash powerful combos by creating uniquely shaped matches, call upon the gods for help, and upgrade the spirits to make them more powerful.

You'll also use your matching prowess to defeat mighty bosses, earn rewarding achievements and complete deviously designed boards packed with challenging obstacles.

With Standard, Advanced and Untimed (casual) modes, Ancient Stories: Gods of Egypt offers a thrilling experience for every player. Will you stop the incantation before Tutmos spells doom for your city?

Key features:

• Dozens of exciting levels
• Eye-catching visuals
• Nail-biting storyline
• Simple mouse-based controls
• Learn-as-you play tutorial

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Creeping Terror
クリーピング・テラー
boardgame.description:
Creeping Terror (Japanese: CREEPING TERROR クリーピング・テラー) is a 2D survival horror video game developed by Nikkatsu Corporation and Mebius for the Nintendo 3DS eShop and Steam.[1] It was released in Japan on January 8, 2017, and it was published in western regions by Aksys Games where it was released on October 31, 2017. Inspired by traditional horror, the story follows a group of teenage friends who journey into an abandoned mansion with the intent of recording their experiences for an online video, and soon find themselves on the run from a terrifying figure. Players control Arisa, a Japanese exchange student, who must use only her wits and what's around her to find her friends and escape with her life.[2][3][4]

As with many other horror games, the main story is left purposefully vague and ambiguous, with in-game materials providing supplementary information on the game's background and lore.[5][6]

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Creeping_Terror_%28video_game%29 Creeping Terror (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: The Last Birdling
boardgame.description:
Bimonia is one of the last Birdlings alive on this earth. The Birdlings see humans as sworn enemies, and Bimonia has been taught to kill on sight.

One day, Bimonia meets Tayo, a human child hunting in the forest. Bimonia fails to kill Tayo, and they instead become friends. Mother will be furious if she finds out, or worse, this relationship may cause tension between the two species to erupt.

The Last Birdling explores Bimonia and Tayo's fight for their friendship as the world threatens to tear them apart.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Conquer
boardgame.description:
The game board is similar to Ludo with four bases and a cross-shaped playspace.

Capturing is done when a player's piece lands exactly on a space occupied by an opponent's piece. The player's piece then moves together with the opponent's piece and brings it back to base. The capture is then complete.

If a player lands on a space occupied by an opponent with a captured piece, he may capture the opponent and set the captured piece free. There are green safety spaces on the board where pieces cannot be captured.

The game ends when all of one player's pieces are captured. The player with the most captured pieces wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Banzai Escape
boardgame.description:
Amino Corp have been suspected of committing some suspicious activity that has led the Bureau Investigation agency to send some of their agents to investigate the company. Some Weeks have passed however there has been no response from those agents sent. The agency has requested help from P.A.S.K.A.L to go into the Amino Corp building to arrest the CEO, Mr. Betas and to rescue those agents. A member of the P.A.S.K.A.L unit, Rokiahi has been sent on the mission, however some unexpected things have begun to happen.
Settings
Control Rokiahi in an Action + Rail Shooter + Third Person game. Graphics fully 3D with Anime themes plus Moeness.
WARNING
This game is hard! Expect to die lots of times.
Features

Enjoy the first beautiful made game by mostly Xenoaisam
Customize armament for fighting ahead
Moddable game that allows custom user creation
Know the prologue story of SpecBeta

Modding Capabilities

Allows modding custom skin for main characters
Allows adding custom dialogue or language translations
Allows adding custom voice for dialogues

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: A Light in the Dark
boardgame.description:
──We cannot choose in this unfair world.

Hao-Chen Jiang did not understand what it was when he opened his eyes. Before him was a dim and dreary room that he had not seen before. Trying to get up to turn on the lights, he finds that his arms are tied behind him and that is when he realizes that he's been kidnapped. It is then that a mysterious girl appears before him and with a look of disdain tells him that he's been kidnapped and unless his family agrees to pay a ransom he has no chance to escape. But perhaps there is more to this than just money...

The rich boy stuck in his never changing daily life...
The fierce girl struggling for survival...
Two people in totally opposite positions in life.

During his days of imprisonment, they will learn of a world they were never aware of which will crumble away at their deep-rooted prejudices. In the face of confusion and the choices before them, what will they find...?

A Light in the Dark is an original visual novel game from the creative minds of CreSpirit (Developers of Rabi-Ribi), Storia (Developers of Dong-jin Rice-hime) and Narrator (Developers of Companion).

The game features a story part and an interactive part where Hao-Chen can examine the items around him as he tries to formulate a plan to escape his kidnappers but beware of your stamina! A Light in the Dark also features multiple endings and language options in English, Traditional Chinese and Simplified Chinese.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Detective Girl of the Steam City
boardgame.description:
Sophie is a private investigator not unlike Sherlock Holmes. She resides in the Steam City, a metropolis going through an industrial revolution.

In this growing city with a huge population, there are many different kinds of people; industrialists, workers, merchants, and your average citizens.

However, within any big city, there are always criminals and conspiracies. The Steam City will need a detective on the case!

It’ll be up to Sophie to uncover the mysteries of the Steam City through her investigations.

What mysteries and intrigue await her?

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Konami Collector's Series: Castlevania & Contra
boardgame.description:
Description
The Beginning of a Legend...

Return to the roots of Castlevania and Contra in one exclusive package on the PC. This collection of games brings the non-stop action, suspense and great gameplay of these fan-favorite games home for the first time in over a decade.

5 Complete classic KONAMI games: Castlevania, Castlevania II: Simon's Quest, Castlevania III: Dracula's Curse, Contra and Super C.
Two of KONAMI's most popular franchises in one package
Quick save allows saving at any time.

The bloodline of the Belmont clan returns along with their ultimate nemesis Dracula in the three games that started it all: Castlevania, Simon's Quest, and Dracula's Curse.

In Contra and Super C, Red Falcon is invading Earth and only two heroes can stand up to the hoards of alien forces.

Please play in a well lit room while sitting or standing as far away from the screen as possible. In rare cases, light flashes from the game may cause eye pain, headaches, seizures, or blackouts. If you experience any of these symptoms, please stop playing immediately and consult a doctor.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Heartbearers
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

It's a dangerous world of heroes and monsters. You play in pairs: a sentient weapon and their bearer. You go on thrilling adventures with other pairs. Be the greatest fighter pair through the ultimate feat of strength: making friends!

Long ago weapons realized that their bearers can get really hurt in battle, so culture shifted: the goal of combat changed to skillfully clash weapons, not harm bearers. Two weapons going head to head can show off their magic, abilities, and legends. Colors burst, sparks fly—it's intense!

boardgame.name: The Dyer Lich
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Based upon a local legend from colonial Maryland, The Dyre Lich gives voice to a woman who stood in defiance of her own era, and was unjustly scapegoated for it.

boardgame.name: Spielbox-Almanach 25 Jahre Hans im Glück Beilage
boardgame.description:
This punchboard which was sold with the spielbox-Almanach "25 Jahre Hans im Glück" contains five tiles for Carcassonne (old design) Carcassonne: The Cult and six tiles for Stone Age (Stone Age: The New Huts).
.

boardgame.name: Carcassonne: Spiel Doch! Expansion
boardgame.description:
Issue 2/2018 (autumn/winter 2018) of the German boardgame magazine SPIEL DOCH! published in September 2018 contained a punchboard with 4 tiles: 2 for Carcassonne and 2 for Carcassonne: Safari

This entry is for the 2 Carcassonne tiles using the artwork for the more recent printings.

One tile shows a donkey stable and the other a garden for the Abbott. You can use these tiles to play the variant where the player who manages to place the two new tiles in the correct order immediately receives five extra points.

boardgame.name: Carcassonne: Safari – Spiel Doch! Expansion
boardgame.description:
Issue 2/2018 (autumn/winter 2018) of the german boardgame magazine SPIEL DOCH! published in september 2018 contained a punchboard with 4 tiles: 2 for Carcassonne and 2 for Carcassonne: Safari

This entry is for the 2 Carcassonne: Safari tiles.

One shows an elephant/lion and the other a zebra/giraffe.

boardgame.name: Artefact
boardgame.description:
Artefact is a story game for one player, designed for contemplative solo play.

In the classic dungeon crawl, you follow the lives of adventurers as they overcome challenges to gain prestige and, most importantly, magical treasures. But what were those treasures doing before the adventurers came along? How many aeons have passed, in silent darkness, since they were last used?

Artefact shifts the focus to the perspective of a single magical item, and its history as it passes through the hands of many different keepers. You’ll feel the weight of time as the item is lost or abandoned again and again, the dust & decay piling around it until it’s found again by someone new.

It's a great way to spend an hour; sketching, world-building and storytelling in your own company. It's also a fantastic way to generate really unique items for tabletop games like D&D, with detailed histories far more vivid than any you'd typically find in a compendium.

boardgame.name: Blackroot Trudge
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Blackroot Trudge is adventure/dungeon for Mörk Borg. It is designed to be used in a campaign in any forest or as a one-shot: perhaps the PCs were asked to investigate the recent disappearances in the local village, the lack of game in the forest, or perhaps the crazy old men at the tavern swore they “saw a bleeding tree”?

Nevertheless, as the PCs wander through the forest, they encounter a tree which oozes blood - all it takes is one PC to remotely approach the tree and roots shoot from the ground, dragging all the unfortunate souls of the party underground.

boardgame.name: The Amalgamation
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

A class for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: The Disgruntled Innkeeper
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

A class for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Misanthropic Messenger
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

A class for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Mustachio
boardgame.description:
COME and Join this amazing trick taking game of strategy, quick wits, bidding, and point winning! Great for teamwork and strategizing with a team to be the boldest and most devious Nut on the planet!
Know your Cards! Some cards have points, some have tricks, and some have powers!

boardgame.name: Swag and Sorcery
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Send out raiding parties that operate independently from your control (as much as you wish), while you build up skills and items on characters that remain in town.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Croatia
Monopoly: Hrvatska
boardgame.description:
The goal of the game is to buy property, rent it, resell it, gain as much money as possible and by the end of the game become the only player on the board.

The Monopoly Croatia lets you buy Zagreb sights (the building of the Croatian National Theater and the Museum of Arts and Crafts), Pula Arena, the enchanting islands of Hvar and Brac, the Plitvice lakes, baroque Varaždin, Dubrovnik, Rovinj, Rijeka...

boardgame.name: Le jeu des petits cyclistes
boardgame.description:
With Le jeu des petits cyclistes, the Little Cyclists game, simulate all the biggest races of the season (Tour de France, Paris-Roubaix, world championships, etc...).
Retrieve the specificities of the peloton, mountain passes or cobbled sectors.
Attack (like Pierre Rolland!), Suck the wheel…
adopt the right strategy to achieve victory!

—description from back of the box (translated)

A simplified version of Um Reifenbreite.

boardgame.name: Gü
boardgame.description:
The Güs are experts on plants and they have given funny names to each full with the letter ü. They have created secret recipes, with different ingredients for each plant to heal them. These can not be mixed up! Only the appropriate combination of crystals can help with the messy sprouts and the rashes, too. The healing crystals must be collected on certain clearings in the forest. But the trees are in continuous motion, the entrances of the clearings are changing their place, which can make the Güs job easier or harder. The movement can also lead to
unexpected meetings with forest creatures.

The aim of the game is to collect the correct color combinations and help as many plants as
you can during the game. The player who collects the most recipe cards and heals the most plants
is the winner.

The game ends when there are no recipe cards left. The player who collected the most recipe
cards and healed the most plants is the winner. If there is an equal number of recipe cards then it’s
a tie, you are both equally good healers!

boardgame.name: The Generic Gangster Chase Game
boardgame.description:
An independent publication from 1981, this umpired two-player game features two indoor "chases," one set in an office building and one in a warehouse.

The basic theme of each scenario is that Big Jim, a mob hitman, is seeking to rub out ace reporter Ace Wilson.

This is a refereed tactical, man-to-man scale game. In this case the game scale is literal, in that each of the two players only has one counter. The actions a player can take include listening, moving, and fighting -- although only Big Jim has a gun, which Ace tries to offset with his greater speed.

It's film noir action, in the form of seven counters and an 8.5x11 map (backprinted, as each scenario uses its own map).

—user summary

boardgame.name: Sitz Krieg ohne Hass: Orders of Battle – Fall of France
boardgame.description:
Fall of France Orders of Battle'' for use with the Sitz Krieg Ohne Hass Rules.

They have been based on the many available publications on the actual fighting formations of the combatant armies for the nations involved.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Sitz Krieg ohne Hass: WWII Corps level wargame rules

boardgame.name: Green vs Tan: Fury Farm Battleset
boardgame.description:
This product is for the original Green Vs. Tan: Where Dingos Dare skirmish game, and is essentially two things.
- First, its a terrain pack to make your tabletop a bit more green, and/or a bit more tan, to aid in playing more amusingly immersive games. It serves to represent either a lovely little farmhouse in either Tanland or Greenland, complete with tractors, wells, haystacks, plenty of trees, supply crates, and what's that?
TWO NEW CHARACTERS? Why yes! After all, no Fury Farm Battleset is ever complete with a set of new characters to send into battle alongside your Green Guard and Tanzer Elite veterans!

- For the second detail of what this product is, you'll find the agreeable Sergeant “Shooty” Sean representing the Green Guard, a rather light-footed fellow who is well known for his proficiency with the submachine gun. A good chap for all the sticky, tough jobs, Sean is also quite a card-player and is known for enjoying any and all types of Green Tea. Get it? Green tea!
And for the Tanzer Elite we have the mysterious, gas-mask wearing Sergeant “Shadowy” Sylvia, one of the few Tanzer Elite soldiers who made it through the Battle of Tanky Meadows and the Retreat Through Popsy Pass with all of her bits intact! Quiet, evasive, and somewhat eerie, she is known to other Tanzer Elite troops as a bit of a lone wolf, yet commands great respect due to her distinguished military career. Oh, and despite the rumors circulating amongst the Tan forces, she is not Sergeant "Blast" Belle, who also survived both Tanky Meadows and Popsy Pass, has many of the same combat distinctions and honors, and also hails from Tanzington.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Green vs Tan: Where Dingos Dare

boardgame.name: eCrew Development Program: McDonald's Training Game
boardgame.description:
eCrew Development Program: McDonald's Training Game (クルトレ eCDP) is an educational video game created by McDonald's.

Released for the Nintendo DS in 2010 internally within the Japanese division of McDonald's, it was only ever distributed to the company's own restaurants domestically and never released to the public.

The game teaches the player how to cook various McDonald's menu items and perform other restaurant tasks, and was used to train new restaurant employees. It features several game modes and features, including simulations of food preparation and customer interaction, quizzes, player profiles for employees and managers, and performance statistics.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ECrew_Development_Program ECrew Development Program]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Have You Heard About the Beast?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have you Heard About the Beast is a game of tavern rumours and hearsay. You sit in a tavern or other location where the adventurous gather and share rumours of a foul beast that lives nearby. The locals join in, adding all sorts of colourful nonsense to the creature's description.

Thing is, every bit of it true.

Glowing eyes the size of shields and jaws that could crush your skull. Someone even told me it communes with the birds to learn out secrets.

It's true! And I heard it guards the hut of a long dead witch who knew the secret to eternal life. The one who slays it could live forever!

It’s all about creating ludicrous encounters with beasts for oneshots, convention games and sidequests in your regular campaign. Play the part of the tavern patrons sharing these rumours, than take your party off to confront them.

Have You Heard About the Beast? is broadly compatible with fantasy RPGs and highly adaptable to other settings as you provide all the stats for the creatures and content is flexible to suit your setting.

This game is played collaboratively with groups of adventurers and a GM, and will accommodate any reasonable RPG group size. The game comes with random roll tables that provide ideas but many of the best ideas will come from within your group.
boardgame.rpgpodcastepisode: 265 – Have You Heard About the Beast? with Scott Paladin

boardgame.name: We Sail Beyond
We Sail Beyond The Edge For Adventure Lies There
boardgame.description:
from inside book
We Sail Beyond is a group-focused map generation tool suitable for use with your fantasy RPG of choice. It takes tried and tested hexmap methods and shifts the focus away from the GM to allow everyone in the group to take part in creating a world of adventures. As part of play you’ll create a player’s map filled with rumours, and a GM’s map that contains the truth.
boardgame.rpgproducer: Tsuyoshi Hashiguchi (はしぐち つよし)

boardgame.name: Apothecaria - A Solo Journalling RPG
boardgame.description:
Apothecaria is a solo journalling RPG in which you take the role of a village witch creating potions for the unfortunate villagers, adventurers, and monsters that come to you for help. The potions you create and the stories that unfold come together to create a beautiful journal that is unique and personal to you. Fill pages with drawings of ingredients, stories of run-ins with thieving fairies and sleeping giants, and recipes for the potions you have created to keep you right in the future.

With loads of unique ailments like Fairy Fever, Candlesick, and Yeti Chest, Apothecaria aims to capture the humour and feel of games like Theme Hospital and Stardew Valley with the cosiness and wonder of Studio Ghibli films.

Source: The Kickstarter.

boardgame.name: Jenga: Godzilla Extreme Edition
boardgame.description: Classic Jenga reskinned and rethemed with a Godzilla mechanic that forces players to draw increasingly higher numbers of blocks on their turns.

boardgame.name: Coral Sea: Variant Kit
boardgame.description:
Coral Sea is a variant expansion to the Midway war game.
Each player has his own map of the Pacific far west of Midway, near Indonesia and the Philippines behind a screen.
They search for the enemy fleet by moving search planes to the hex and calling the hex number. Once found, bombers can be sent in to sink the enemy fleet.
The actual attack is fought on a separate battle board where the ships are first placed on hexes and the attacking planes are placed in hexes to indicate which ship it is attacking.

Note: the rules and maps for the Coral Sea Variant were published in General Magazine Vol. 15, #5, counters were available separately via ordering through Avalon Hill.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Vampires & Claymores
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Vampires & Claymores is a pamphlet Tabletop RPG about recently turned vampires discovering more about themselves while avoiding losing their minds to the everlasting hunger.

Vampires & Claymores features:

- A minimalistic d6 pool system .
- A Blood spending mechanic to keep the tension sky high*.
- A Skill learning system that intertwines with the emmergent story being told.
- Free-form magic rules.
- A Feral mechanic that accounts for vampires going insane for Blood and losing touch with humanity.

boardgame.name: Arkham Horror (Third Edition): Extended-Art Investigator Card Packs
boardgame.description:
12 extended art promo cards:
Wendy Adams
Tommy Muldoon
Rex Murphy
Agnes Baker
Jenny Barnes
Dexter Drake
Calvin Wright
Marie Lambeau
Michael McGlen
Minh Thi Phan
Norman Withers
Daniela Reyes

boardgame.name: Cepheus Journal (Issue 004)
boardgame.description:
From the website description

Welcome to issue #004 of the Cepheus Journal, the thickest issue yet at 56 pages. In this issue, many settings are represented: Historical, Modern and Science Fiction.

For historical settings we have an article about smuggling and piracy in the 18th century and some cog travelling in the middle ages (both from the editorial team.)

For a modern setting, there is a Chinese infantry squad by Ewan Spence.

For science fiction settings we have two articles about close stars. 40 Eridani by Randy McDonald and Altair Subsector by Neil Lucock. Neil also wrote an article about Ship Damage. For the new (Dune inspired) Science Fiction Setting Godstar from Zozer Games, Neil Lucock has supplied a short adventure. Finally we also have part 2 of Helzr’s Recovery that started in issue #001.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Dr Syn, or, The Scarecrow of Romney March
Helzr's Recovery/Salvage and Repossession Services, Part 2

boardgame.name: Trek 12: de la Saint Valentin
boardgame.description:
Trek 12 de la Saint Valentin is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in february 2021.

It consists in a new player board to play in duo. Play secretly, without looking at the board of the other. Start where you want, then follow the classic rules but with the specific INTENSITY and HARMONY rules and ways to score.

boardgame.name: Satisfy
boardgame.description:
Sexual communication is an extremely important part of any healthy relationship.

Satisfy is a game where two players act as partners, each trying to satisfy each other’s needs by following clues and trying their best to finish as simultaneously as possible.

The players each have a set of increasingly difficult secret Goals that they want to try to satisfy before their hand or the Stimulation Deck runs out of cards. These goals represent different arrangements of the markers on the Shared Experience board.

Inspired by such games as Fog of Love and Codenames, Satisfy will exercise your empathy and understanding by putting both of you in a vulnerable and often hilarious place.

Gameplay

In Satisfy, both players will take turns moving markers along the Shared Experience Board. Each column on the board represents a different aspect of a sexual encounter:


Voice
Touch
Mouth
Genitals


Both players will be moving the four markers up and down these tracks to match the increasingly difficult goal cards in front of their partner. There are five levels of goal cards, and once one is matched it is replace by one of the next higher level.

To move these markers, the players will take turns playing Stimulation cards. These cards indicate two colors whose markers will be pushed. As you play the card, you describe to
your partner what you’re doing to them. Played cards are handed to your partner who adds them to their own hand.

When you match your goal, your partner will draw an Action card. These can be used assist you in your experience. When a final goal is met, begin discarding your Stimulation cards in a race to both finish as close to the same time as possible.

Inclusivity

All pronouns used in the game are non-gendered. This is a game for couples of any orientation or persuaion. The art on the cards features gay, straight, lesbian, and non-binary people.

It is intended for any couple willing to explore how they communicate with each other and are willing to have a fun time.

listing.notes: I'm the designer and producer. You can purchase the game at http://satisfygame.com

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Sapeurs-Pompiers de France
boardgame.description:
Monopoly: Sapeurs-Pompiers de France
The National Federation of Firefighters of France honors firefighters at the heart of the famous Monopoly® game.

In this special edition, the aim will be to bring relief to the population during everyday incidents as well as during major events.
A new fun opportunity to familiarize yourself with the world of firefighters, with family or friends.

boardgame.name: Trek 12: Philitrek
boardgame.description:
Trek 12: Philitrek is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the authors and a gameshop with the participation of Martin Vidberg.

It consists in a new player board and new ways to score. Go on the conquest of the PhiliMountain with this new ascension.

listing.notes: Never played Language : french Ship only in E.U.

boardgame.name: Fast Friends
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

You are an infamous crew of misfit thieves bound by two things: the shared history that has forged you into a tight-knit family unit and your mutual affinity for ludicrously fast cars. You recently retired to a life of well-earned comfort, but fate has other plans for you...

Fast Friends is a one page, one shot RPG of fast cars and found families for 3-5 players and one GM. It may remind you of a movie series you saw once. This is purely coincidental.

Grab your dice, sit down with some friends, and get ready to live life a quarter mile at a time.

Requirements

1 rule sheet per person
A handful of six-sided dice
Pencils and erasers
A bucket of frosty Coronas (optional)

boardgame.name: Roll Call
boardgame.description:
The board for Roll Call is a 5x5 grid of dice combinations, some using four dice and some using five.

On a turn a player has three rolls of five dice to try to get a combination on any unowned space; if they manage this they claim such a space.

A player wins by claiming four squares in a row (in any direction) or any thirteen squares.

boardgame.name: Magnytour Profil: Tour d'Espagne – Vuelta
boardgame.description:
La Vuelta is one of the main cycling races on the international calendar.
The third grand tour of the year.

This is the adaptation of the race to 10 stages Magnytour.

boardgame.name: Dead Emperors
boardgame.description:
You open the crypt and the stench of unleashed centuries fills your nostrils. The light from your torch flickers weakly as you step towards the tomb, every inch of its stonework finely crafted to fill you with awe. You touch the inscription, taking the dust and cobwebs away. The story of another Dead Emperor has been chiseled into immortal granite beneath your fingertips.

Here lies…

Dead Emperors is a history-building game designed to be used with tabletop roleplaying games or as a standalone storytelling experience. It involves telling stories about the dead monarchs of your world and their legacies. It will shape the present of your game by building its past.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Fake Guru, Real Vice
boardgame.description:
In Fake Guru, Real Vice you are a terrible person who has it all. A beachside villa in Southern California? Sure. A private ski lodge in the French Alps? Of course. A vintage sports car collection? Yes.

How did you get all this? A best-selling but nonsensical self help book. Exploitative motivational seminars. Fad diet programs with unhealthy results. Shoddy fitness product infomercials on late night cable. Televangelism so lucrative you have multiple private jets. You decide. Take a moment to decide how you made your millions. Feel free to base it on a real person.

Problem is, the vice, secrets and dirty tricks you’ve left in your wake are catching up with you. You made your money from telling other people how to live their lives, but your own private life is a catalogue of vice and base morals.

Recently, a national gossip rag of the lowest order ran a story suggesting they have unearthed a trove of dirt on you, and will reveal it in the near future. Publicly, you laugh it off. Your PR team states the allegations are as baseless as they are scandalous. Threats of lawsuits get waved around by both sides.

Privately, you think “they can’t know, can they?”.

You play to learn what they do know, and whether you can redeem yourself in the face of it. If you succeed, you might come out of the other side a better person, unburdened of their past misdeeds. If you fail, your career and finances will be ruined, and you may even spiral downwards deeper into vice.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Glittering Hoards
boardgame.description:
Glittering Hoards is a simple method for generating colossal hoards of loot. Hoards it would take a thousand adventurers a thousand days to transport away. The kind anyone finding it will barely even scratch the surface of.

It is designed to allow you to simply generate hoards, the places they are kept, and encounters within them. As is traditional, this process is centred on the GM for the most part. We have also included tools for centring this process on the players at each stage and we encourage experimentation with these.

To do this, you populate a 6x6 hexmap with a mix of encounters and loot. This can be the GM in their prep, or everyone as a group at the table.

It can be randomly rolled using the provided tables, your own ideas, or a mix. You can generate and play through a simple one shot. All you need is some paper with hexes, a pencil, and a handful of D6s (36 for the provided hexmap).

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Murke's Peerage of the Manifold Spheres: Volume Scissors Through Widdershins
boardgame.description:
Jonne Murke was Troika!'s pre-eminent scholar of the esoteric, obscene, and transcendant. While most of his work concerned identifying and cataloguing the variant flora and fauna of the divergent spheres, his lesser-known passion was in identifying and cataloguing people.

Murke's Peerage is his seminal work, a registry of noteable personages, a study of the transcendant and the bizarre, and what he called "the definitive account of remarkable noteworthies across Troika! and the Elsewhere Lands".

Existing across several hundred volumes, a complete collection of Murke's Peerage is said only to exist somewhere in the library sphere of Biblonsong. This volume represents a mere fraction of Murke's work, and should be studied in conjunction with other surviving volumes if one wishes to come to a full understanding of the extent of Murke's obsession.

This volume of Murke's Peerage contains details of the following personages:


Bread Gorilla
Wandering Spider Philosopher
Cosmozoologist
Down On Their Luck Space Capsule Jockey With Crushing Debt to Some Bad Dudes
Snake Oil Seller
Ghoul in a Box


'Murke's Peerage of the Manifold Spheres is an independent production by Loot The Room and is not affiliated with the Melsonian Arts Council.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Space is Rubbish and I Want to Go Home
boardgame.description:
Space is Rubbish is tiny and collaborative game for telling stories about space adventures. You went to space for some reason and it's the worst mistake of your life. You want to go home, but distances in space are like, really big and stuff always seems to get in the way.

This is a hack of Jared Sinclair's What's So Cool About Outer Space? made for What's So Cool about Jam. Check those games out too!

It's in A6 format so you can easily print it into your own little booklet, and then you just need a pencil and some normal six-sided dice.

Source: The Publisher Website.
boardgame.rpg: Space is Rubbish and I Want to Go Home
boardgame.rpgseries: What Is So Cool About Jam

boardgame.name: The Tarasque
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

The tarasque is a legendary monster, tales of which emerged in Provence in the late 12th century.

boardgame.name: Nechrosis
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Nechrosis is an escalating apocalypse calendar for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: What Artistry This Wilderness
boardgame.description:
What Artistry This Wilderness is a wilderness travel supplement for fantasy RPGs. It’s a celebration of what makes worlds, both fantastical and our own, delightful. It’s a celebration of the sheer joy, mystery and adventure of travel. It’s a celebration of the incredible work of human beings in capturing those landscapes.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: While We Wait for Death
boardgame.description:
This is a game played wherever warriors gather on the eve of battle. Around a roaring campfire, huddled in a creaking tent, or in a demon-infested dungeon.

Each present knows this coming battle may be their last. Some sit in silence, others fill the silence with tall tales in the hope that past glories might help form tomorrow’s.

While we wait for death to arrive, we tell stories about when they didn’t show up.

While We Wait for Death uses a standard deck of playing cards to simulate the back and forth of shared storytelling and provide prompts to guide the direction of the story.

You can use this game for telling stories that connect your existing RPG characters, or when creating new ones. You could do this this at the start of a campaign to create a shared history, at a campfire outside deadly dungeon, or in the hall of a king during a desperate siege..

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Murderhobo with an Arquebus
boardgame.description: Murderhobo with an Arquebus is a new class for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: The Wendigo: an apex predator for Mörk Borg
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

A new twist on the classic Algonquin legend. Includes stats and ecology to torment your players with.

boardgame.name: Underhill: Blood Queen of the Trow
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

“The villagers implore you to end the trow’s terror and bring their children home. The spiked flail in your hand assures them (and you) that at least one of those outcomes is possible.”

Includes 3 different population configurations; choose one or select randomly using the Contingent Encounter mechanic.

Content warning: No matter who wins, the kids lose.

boardgame.name: ELONA+(F 1.1)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The world of Irva – a land of many continents, many races; but with its diversity comes conflict, and in recent years with strange developments in the land, a conflict has started which many believe will bring about a new age entirely. Far to the east, across the ocean of Asseria, the once dormant forests of Vindale have come to life, producing a dangerous phenomena that scholars have dubbed “the Etherwind”.

boardgame.name: Aberrant
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In 1998, the explosion of the space station Galatea releases a cloud of exotic radiation to spread across the planet. Freak phenomena across the world follows, and less than a month later the world pauses in awe as the first Nova publicly Erupts. More quickly follow, each displaying abilities once limited to the pages of comic-book fiction.

boardgame.name: Fable Jumpchain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Albion is a beautiful country full of lush grasslands, rich fields, and bountiful forests. However even the most beautiful city hides evil that normal people can’t defeat. In this world there are Heroes, these humans are far more capable of defeating the evils of this world. Or perhaps they are but one the evils that lurk in the shadows. This is Fable, a rich and wonderful setting full of fancy English accents and people.

boardgame.name: The Devil's Advocate (Issue 19 - Aug 1984)
boardgame.description:
The Devil's Advocate
August 1984

Shape-Shifters

boardgame.name: T'au
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It was an age of darkness before the Ethereals came. Tau fought tau. Amid the war life was brutal and short. Disease, famine, violence - they were everywhere. Until the Ethereals came. It was they who united the disparate Tau and forged them into a people unified by purpose; the Greater Good. War faded to an unpleasant memory as society blossomed, and technology rose with it. It gave the Tau their world, banishing disease, famine, and fear a like.

Soon the Tau’s reach extended to the stars.

boardgame.name: Cartel
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

It is 2007. The Sinaloa Cartel is the largest drug trafficking organization in the world, a vast network of narcos, halcones, y sicarias moving billions of dollars of drugs into Los Estados Unidos.

Take on the role of someone tied to the Sinaloa Cartel in Durango, Mexico, trying to stay alive in a dangerous game of drugs, money and power. Navigate shifting alliances and deadly schemes, while desperately struggling to hold on to what's yours.

Can you keep your familia safe from the monsters who live in the shadows?

Can toy stay loyal to your amigos when you know that no one can be trusted?

Can you hold on to yourself, güey, when the drug war hungers for your very soul?

Cartel is a tabletop roleplaying game for three to five players that uses a rules-light engine to create tragic narcofiction in the vein of Narcos, Breaking Bad, The Wire and Once Upon A Time in Mexico.

boardgame.name: Old School & Cool (# 1 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Old School & Cool is a bad-ass zine made from angry spirits and bad dreams by the folks at Knight Owl Publishing. Why? Because we thought that Zine Quest was awesome and we have a lot of cool stuff to share with you!

Think of this zine as a set of herbs and spices. You can sprinkle in a bunch and make your game super tasty or just add a dash for a bit of that highlight flavor. It’s your game and you can decide how you want it to taste.

Included inside:

10 bizarre new classes
34 OSR feats
9 new spells
4 Inn menus
10 new types of inns
10 adventurer’s packs
800,00 NPCs
1 space lich
4 magic items
2 dwarven poems
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 278 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue 278
2020

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 279 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue 279
2021

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 276 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue 276
2020

boardgame.name: A Bump in the Night
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The townsfolk of Easthaven are plagued by strange sounds coming from their basements in the middle of the night, only to wake up to find their items missing in the morning. What dark forces lie at the heart of this disturbance?

This is a four-hour Dungeoncraft adventure for the Plague of Ancients campaign for tier 1 (level 1-4) characters, optimized for APL 3. This adventure uses the Burrowing Borrowers adventure seed.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Avarice Everlasting
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A bright sphere of fire has appeared over the town of Termalaine. It showers the town in warmth and light as if it were the sun. The townsfolk celebrate what appears to a blessing from the gods. The truth is the false sun is a beacon conjured by an evil cursed artifact that has been awakened. Now hordes of undead pirates and bandits have seen this beacon and seek to claim the artifact for themselves.

A 4-Hour Dungeoncraft (AL) Adventure for Characters of Level 1st-4th. Based on the “The Warmest Day” Adventure Seed. Optimized for a group of 5 players with an APL3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Roused by Raiders
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A novice group of adventurers foolishly leads a remorhaz threat to the town of Lonelywood. The characters must protect the settlement from these monstrosities and discover why the adventurers were attacked in the first place.

A Tier 2, two hour adventure for Dungeoncraft (Plague of Ancients) using the Out of the Woods Hook. Optimized for APL: 8
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Where are Yew?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dougan's Hole is known to be the smallest and most insular member of the Ten Towns, a perfect target for petty thieves. However, recently crimes have been getting worse. Citizens have gone missing overnight. The townsfolk of Dougan's Hole are on high alert, travelers being their main suspect for the recent tragedies. An adventure featuring kobolds in a trench coat and Part 1 of Rise of Silverclaw.

4 hour Icewind Dale adventure for Level 1-4 characters. Optimized for average party level (APL) 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Riddle Joker
boardgame.description:
For decades, superpowers and psychic abilities were thought to be mere science fiction, but the discovery of a certain particle called the "astron" at the end of the 20th century proved to the world that these wondrous phenomenon were real. Nowadays, these abilities have been dubbed "astral abilities," with those who can wield them being known as "Astrals".

Arihara Satoru is but an ordinary person living in this futuristic world.

However, beneath that guise, he's actually a secret agent working for an organization that uses Astrals.

One day, he receives a new mission:

Pose as a student and infiltrate a famous academy for Astrals.

After successfully transferring into the academy together with his sister Arihara Nanami, he settles into his new life there, meeting new friends like his classmates Mitsukasa Ayase and Nijouin Hazuki, and his upperclassman Shikibe Mayu, among others.

Everything is going according to plan. Not a single person suspects him.

Until an unfortunate accident leads to Mitsukasa Ayase finding out his true identity! And in that situation, he also learns that she has her own big secret...

Her breasts are actually padded!

With that, a boy and a girl both learn of each other's most deepest secret. But little do they know, this fateful encounter will greatly change the course of their lives...

Source: The Publisher Website.
boardgame.videogameversion: リドルジョーカー - Download Edition

boardgame.name: Tick Tack Bumm: Vibrations
boardgame.description:
The bright berry-red bomb, which is known to end the round by exploding, also has another surprise in store: it vibrates randomly and once again makes the other players sweat.

The random vibration of the bomb during the game is new and particularly appealing. The vibrating becomes a wild card that provides unexpected climaxes in a flash.

The starting player grabs the hot bomb and covers one of 220 categories. Now it's a matter of quickly finding suitable words, for example to "pick-up lines", "(im)possible porn titles", "excuses for "not today, honey", "that hangs" or "that is not socially acceptable".

As soon as the word is pronounced, you place the bomb in front of the next player in a flash - because no one knows how long it will tick before it explodes. If it blows up right in front of you, you lose the round and take the card on display as punishment.

boardgame.name: Maize and Monsters (S&W)
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Maize and Monsters is an adventure, that exposes the adventurers to the grim reality that time sometimes exacerbates old wounds rather than healing them. A recent murder in the village of Pilhua proves to be far more than a simple crime of passion as the seeds for this killing were sown during a previous, unsolved mystery that still haunts some residents within the settlement. The characters must wade through a list of suspects and motives that lead them to discover the ugly truth about a heinous crime that spawned a greater evil than even its perpetrators could ever imagine.

boardgame.name: Stone Age: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
This insert is compatible with Stone Age, including Stone Age: The Expansion, The New Huts, Casino and The Mammoth Herd. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.
The design works equally well with the Stone Age: Anniversary edition.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 31.7 x 22.7 x 9.2 cm.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 1812: Eagles in the East
boardgame.description:
1812: Eagles in the East is a game from the Eagles of France series. This module proposes to play all the major battles of the 1812 campaign and more. The full order of battle at different points of the campaign is included allowing players to play a lot of less known battles in following expansions.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Black Plague – Knight Pack: Feldherr Foam Tray
boardgame.description: Awesome Monster insert for Zombicide Black Plague. In the tray fit the Zombicide Bosses and the Kickstarter exclusives like the huge Abominarat. For all who do not want to transport the Abominarat in the foam tray, you can take out the separate, free inlay. This then can be easily transport tokens, character cards, dice and other game components. In addition, the foam tray has different sized compartments for heroes and zombies.

boardgame.name: Zombillénium: Fear Factory
boardgame.description:
Based on the eponymous comic series, this game makes you the team leader of a group of monster employees in a horror amusement park.

Each turn, choose judiciously to which ride you'll send your workers to scare the visitors most efficiently. If the fear markers on the ride, the visitor and your monster employee match, then you gain control over that ride for this round.

If you gain control over 3 rides in one and the same round, you win. If you've gained control over 13 rides over the course of the game, you win.

boardgame.name: The Game of Korners
boardgame.description: Players must complete as many boxes as possible by matching the four colored corners of the tiles immediately surrounding the box. The player who has the most tokens on the board when the grid is completed is the winner.

boardgame.name: MiniQuest Adventures
boardgame.description:
MiniQuest Adventures is a 1 to 4 player cooperative dungeon book game where you will have to repel the evil forces from the ancient evil dungeons.

The players will control a group of heroes while they defeat foes controlled by the game.

Moving through rooms filled with enemies, the heroes will find weapons, armors and spells. Each room will present an unique skirmish random generated situation where players must think each turn which position take in the grid and roll the combat dice to determine the success of his attacks and spells.

At the end of each floor, our group of heroes must face a challenging final boss, which will reward with special items to give a chance to face the next rooms on deeper levels.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
Includes metal heroes minatures.
Contact me for bank transfer.
Item located in UK. Buyers in Europe are responsible for any tax/import duties.

Shrink-wrapped with two extra sets of dice.
Shipping costs within Germany: 5,99 EUR Within the EU on request
New Kickstarter copy of the game. Still in shrinkwrap.
Game came from Kickstarter campaign . It is still in foil. I can send picture if requested.

Not in shrink but unplayed. Shipping in Germany would be 5.99€ and payment is either via Paypal or Bank transfer.
Please message me for international shipping rates.

Opened and played once. Unluckily, my wife did not liked it and I think it may get more opportunities to go to table on another home.
Additionally to the components, it has a couple of 3d printed organizers for tokens
Shipping with Mondial Relay where available for lowest shipment costs.
Opened but unplayed, includes 3D printed insert.

boardgame.name: Gorynich
Горыныч, жги!
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the world of Russian fairytales! Fire-breathing dragon Zmei Gorynich and a beautiful princess lived in a high terem (tower) until hordes of greedy knights attracted by hidden riches disturbed the peace.

Help Gorynich to defend the princess and the goods in the enthralling cooperative game. Each round secretly draft the action to program the movement of the dragon. Gorynich can fly around the board, burn the knights and use special maneuvers to cast fireballs, choose any direction or return to terem by the call of the princess. However, treacherous knights respond with counter-maneuvers and inexorably march to the terem. When all the players made their choice, reveal the action tiles and watch the battle!

The players win if they defeated all the knights and lose if any defender reached the princess, the dragon moved beyond the edges of the board or a reckless attack burned the terem.

And for the most capable dragons there is advanced mode with additional maneuvers and even more challenging board!

-description from publisher

listing.notes: German edition! In perfect condition. Played only once. Nonsmoker household without animals. Payment via PayPal or wire transfer. (The buyer bears any costs that may arise upon payment and shipping.)

boardgame.name: Rites of Vengeance
boardgame.description:
Rites of Vengeance is a Wretched and Alone game:

Once you had a normal life: A routine, connections, belongings.

Then one day it was all shattered. You will never forget the date it happened. You will never forget what you lost. You will never forget who is to blame. You suffered, severed from purpose. Your anger grew hungrier.

You sought an answer. You found it. There is only one way to live with the remembering. Your voracious anger must be sated on the one who is to blame. But satisfying the depth of your hunger is beyond human means, only a truly unearthly rage can mete out the punishment required. The power of The Demon is the only way. So you searched for The Teacher... to teach you The Ritual.

The Teacher has finally agreed to guide you, with the warning that it will take weeks to prepare for The Ritual. It will cost you, it will change you, and it is more dangerous than you can possibly imagine. The power of The Demon is only for the truly desperate.

PDF available at: https://reverendunclebastard.itch.io/rites-of-vengeance

Risograph printed copy available at: https://www.exaltedfuneral.com/products/rites-of-vengeance-p...

boardgame.name: Bitwa o Włocławek 1920
boardgame.description:
Bitwa o Włocławek 1920 focuses on the successful defense of the Polish city of Włocławek against the Bolshevik troops during the Polish-Soviet War (1919-1920).

Fought at the same time as the Battle of Warsaw it ended as a Polish victory and stopped the Soviet advance.

The game was designed for the 100'th anniversary of the battle and was released on the 14'th of August 1920.

It is a hex and counter wargame for two players. One of them will take control of the attacking Soviet troops, while the second one will be playing the Polish side, defending Włocławek at all cots.

boardgame.name: Pandafeche
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

A sleep paralysis demon for your Mörk Borg games.

boardgame.name: The Beast of Bremen
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

The 12th century German fairytale "The Town Musicians of Bremen" features four destitute and aging farm animals that form a band and frighten some robbers who mistake them for a terrible monster in the dark. This humble offering for the multiple Ennie Award-winning MÖRK BORG role-playing game/doom metal album/spiked flail to the face takes the frightful hellbeast from the imaginations of those medieval German scum and brings it into the game where it can torment your Tvelander scum.

This supplement was part of Rugose Kohn's FÖLK LORE game jam for MÖRK BORG.

boardgame.name: Black Stump
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Something weird is happening in Sarkash down a well covered in human fur. The Black Stump is a new dungeon for Mörk Borg filled with strange and weird encounters for your players to interact with. Angry Liches, dead people and a weird stain on the floor that goes deeper than anyone can imagine...

boardgame.name: Control: Ultimate Edition
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Compilation of Control and it's two expansions
boardgame.videogameversion: European Xbox Sereis X Blu-Ray edition

boardgame.name: Kram
boardgame.description:
Tense and exciting word game.

1998 Mensa Select Winner

boardgame.name: Pop'n Find Choco
boardgame.description: Roll the dice and pick a chocolate piece with the corresponding symbol under it. But watch out for the green bug, because if you choose him you lose one of your chocolates - and all the chocolates get mixed again.

boardgame.name: Piston Cup Championship Game
boardgame.description:
Complete the laps in the game as quickly as possible, but watch out for Obstacles!! Oil Slicks (back one square), Blowouts (back two squares), Curves (no passing), and Accidents (skip a turn) will slow you down, but the Acceleration Zone (keep rolling) will give you a boost!

Cars (playing pieces) move clockwise. Players each take turns rolling the die and advancing the number of squares indicated on the die. No more than three cars may occupy the same square at one time. If a fourth car lands on this square or tries to pass, the car must stop one square behind.

The number of laps depends on the number of players. The first player to cross the finish line (checkerboard square) after completing the requisite number of laps wins the game!

boardgame.name: Tooth & Claw (Beastiary)
boardgame.description:
Tooth & Claw is an in-depth fantasy field guide that takes real world zoological concepts and - with a dash of pseudo-science - uses them to re-imagine fantasy creatures. From dragons melting gold to armour themselves to lemur inspired wyven social dynamics.

Each creature entry will have in-universe field notes on aspects such as behaviour, physiology, and ecology. Entries will also have notes on things like their habitats, diets, and useful tips for adventurers like how to tell the age of a dragon by the purity of its scale armour.

The level of realism in creature design is inspired by the Monster Hunter games which do an excellent job at creating fantasy creatures that feel believable.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: A Salt Kiss Remains
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

A Salt Kiss Remains is game of mermaids, magic, and monsters in the great open sea and the land it crashes upon. We play as denizens of the ocean or other aquatic environments, exploring and protecting this world. These adventures can be lighthearted and fun, exploring sunken ruins of ancient humans, falling in love, and building families, and they can reach like the sea ever deeper. In these dark depths, we explore the damage humans cause to the oceans, what it means to be predator and prey, and the unfathomable mysteries of this vast world.

boardgame.name: Current Assets: The Belfast Investment Game
boardgame.description:
A monopoly-inspired board game showing off the businesses of the city of Belfast in Northern Ireland.

The goal is to be the last player not to go bankrupt.

boardgame.name: Outward - The Soroboreans
Outward - Сороборцы
Outward - 소로보리언
Outward – Die Soroboreaner
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Continuation of the adventures in F.A.T.H.O.M., with more content, skill trees, new weapon types, dungeons and more!

boardgame.name: Chasing the Ace
boardgame.description:
From the itch.io blurb:
Chasing the Ace is a GMless, card-based storytelling game of mecha drama. In it, players take on the role of a mecha squadron lead by the legendary Ace. The Ace has led your squadron out of deadly situations more times than you can count. Together you've saved thousands of lives over the course of the war you find yourselves in. But the Ace has confided in you a secret: at midnight tonight, they are going to steal their mecha. They have not told you why, but they have asked you to join them. With you, they say, they stand a chance. You have until midnight to decide.

Failure risks execution for treason. But do you even want to help them?

Chasing the Ace is a Descended From the Queen game for 3-5 players. To play it, you just need a deck of regular playing cards and this book. It is a game of interpersonal drama set amidst a war between a paramilitary organization, its mecha pilots, and monstrous beings that threaten the world. Together, you will define the war, the Ace, and your characters over the course of play, until you are finally faced with your decision. Each session takes around an hour to play.

Check out the demo file below, which lays out the full rules and setting premise.

boardgame.name: Chess: Two Kingdoms
boardgame.description:
from the itch.io blurb:

A narrative-driven tabletop roleplaying game that uses chess instead of dice. You are two neighboring countries in conflict. One by one, different parts begin to move, and tell their share of a bigger story. For 2 players (or more in teams).

boardgame.name: The Black Gnarl Road
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Black Gnarl Road is a short quest for a party of first or second level, initially created as a Play-by-Post adventure for backers of The Blood Queen's Defiance box set Kickstarter. It precedes the action of the box set, providing some non-spoiler clues and details about the area and events. This adventure can be used to travel any dangerous forest road in your sandbox game.

boardgame.name: My Gold Mine
boardgame.description: Diamonds, precious stones, and gold — an immeasurable treasure is hidden deep in the cave in My Gold Mine, and each dwarven player wants to dig for gold nuggets. The keeper of the mountain, a fire-breathing dragon, will chase after you, though, so who can leave the gold mine with the most nuggets, and who will be too greedy and get caught by the dragon?

boardgame.name: 5G
boardgame.description:
A competitive, technological-style strategy game with worker placement at its core. Players take on the roles of corporate communication giants to obtain the greatest wealth. This is achieved by carrying out R&D as well as purchasing, producing, upgrading and implementing strategies which better serve the needs of 5G orders in different regions of the world.

Players use 'mouse' tokens which act as your workers to perform actions. Then produce and place 5G Stations, gaining resources, selecting 5G Order Cards, and finally launching projects based on actions taken earlier. The game ends when all players have completed 10 level 4 5G Orders, and the player with the most money wins!

boardgame.name: Pusheen Purrfect Pick
boardgame.description:
Pusheen Purrfect Pick is a game about planning a purrfect weekend starring Internet sensation Pusheen the Cat!

In Pusheen Purrfect Pick, players move Pusheen around the board, collecting essentials as she romps around. Play in Pusheen's house or flip the board over to play in the park! Essentials include friends — like Pusheenicorn or Dragonsheen — or items like gems and cupcakes. Turn in essentials to collect snapshots in which they appear, like Dragonsheen's Lair or a Catfé Date. Each snapshot is worth a certain number of stars. Collect ten stars to win!

boardgame.name: Last Aurora: Neoprene Game Mat
boardgame.description:
Neoprene Game Mat 31.5" x 22" for the Last Aurora Board Game

Game Mat used to collect common cards and resources with the alpha map printed on the mid.

Compatible will all other road maps as the cardboard mats fit across the middle of the neoprene mat.

boardgame.name: Green Guardians
boardgame.description:
Green Guardians is a strategic resource management game based on the scarcity, risk, and cost-benefit of natural resource use. Green Guardians is inspired by the precious natural world around us that is being irreparably altered through climate change and habitat destruction. The challenge for the Guardians is to find the balance of seeking prosperity without polluting the world beyond recovery.

Green Guardians is a strategic game for 2-4 players, recommended for ages 10 and up, and after a quick setup lasts 45-60 minutes. Players' choices drive the action and competition but random events provide an extra challenge.

Guardians explore the undiscovered world to gather resources. The resources can be used to build and upgrade to structures that provide additional resources and research. However their actions create waste that accumulates over time to form pollution that prevents the structures from working. In addition, the use of resources subjects the Guardians to disasters that slow down their progress. Guardians overcome these challenges by using their resources to research abilities and cleanup the pollution to keep their buildings productive.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Indommus: Reyes Destronados
boardgame.description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.





Put yourself in the shoes of a monarch, who must dethrone another king to ensure his power and conquer.

Indommus is a collectible card game where you will have different types of cards to build your deck and develop a strategy that leaves your opponent out of the game.

Each player has 40 life points, and will achieve victory by leaving his opponent at 0 life points. However, it is also possible to win the battle by leaving your opponent with no cards in his deck.

The Indommus card system modifies the current standards of Trading Card Games, by not having a rarity system, allowing all players to easily get their cards.

Defeat your opponent and become the most powerful monarch on the continent.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Co-Open
boardgame.description:
☆ remember your first solo shopping trip?

co-open is a game about a kid's first time buying groceries on their own. Looks like it's time to explore and have some fun!
♲ a classic loaf of rye bread, some birthday cards, and kompot

The products available in the local cooperatively run store are community-selected, trying to suit everybody's needs. You might not find everything you're expecting, but maybe there will be something that surprises you!

Check the information on product price tags to make sure you only pick fresh local produce, call your grandmother for a suggestion, or just go with whatever catches your eye! Just try not to feed the store cats off the shelves. Please. They are fed regularly.
☃ anything else?

You can get your ice cream and veggies in a few minutes to rush back home sooner — or stray away from the shelves and find yourself a part of a drawing class in the rooftop park, or an underground snowskate hangout! Don't be scared to check things out.
❀ making memories

Looks like your neighbor friend is also shopping today! But could you meet anybody else? What if it's a very (very) big crow, or a mysterious vent dweller? Maybe you will even have some meaningful mementos after your adventures!
☏ so, how was your day?

In the end, grandma will always come to pick you up. What will she say about your shopping trip — or, more importantly, about your product picks?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The White Glove Affair
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

The Heist of a Lifetime

You may not think of yourself as a criminal, but when you've got a surefire tip that'll let you steal one of the Prophets of Kallistrade's golden commerce barges... well, those people basically worship money, so they've got it coming. (And besides, they're insured.) But when the heist goes wrong and your plan turns into a long con, can you stay ahead of the Kalistocrats long enough to make off with the loot?

This volume of Starfinder Adventure Path continues the Fly Free or Die Adventure Path and includes:


"The White Glove Affair," a Starfinder adventure for 7th-level characters, by Kendra Leigh Speedling.



The history and philosophy of the Prophets of Kalistrade in the Starfinder setting, including a Kalistocrat archetype for player characters, by Randal Meyer.



Three side jobs, short adventures that can be played in one session by Joshua Herrington and Lu Pellazar.



An archive of alien creatures by Violet Hargrave, Joshua Herrington, Lu Pellazar, and Kendra Leight Speedling.



Statistics and deck plans for the Kalisocracy's golden commerce barges and Fortune's Heart, the secret trade resort the Prophets have concealed in the Drift, by Kendra Leigh Speedling.

Chess [Mac OS X]
Skak

User Summary

Build in version of Chess, available from Mac OS X Tiger (10.4) and newer (both Power PC and Intel based)

boardgame.name: HEXplore It: The Domain of Mirza Noctis
boardgame.description:
Krasvetelia. The sun sets on this cold and desolate place. Once a beautiful land of craggy mountains, fertile valleys, and deep bottomless chasms, it has now wilted like a rose in winter.

The small kingdom, tucked away from the rest of the world, has had few rulers in its time. None certainly as evil as their current. It is rumored that Mirza Noctis came to power some two-hundred years ago. Eternally youthful, the man is whispered to have controlled the bloodlines of this place, carefully arranging unions between noble families and culling those of weaker bloodlines.

Now, the peoples of Krasvetelia live a harsh life, starved of happiness. Writing is outlawed and the caste system in place prevents all but a handful of nobles from holding titles and land in Noctis’s name. Up until recently, starving to death was most of Krasvetelian’s worries. But more and more, people are going missing in this land. Devoured by darkness, some say...

The scholars, left to themselves in their remote monasteries, have recently unearthed a terrible secret: Mirza Noctis is working tirelessly, his agents harvesting blood from the local populous. Years of unattachment to this land have left the people mostly unaware of his actions. But a terrifying fact is now clear: Noctis is working towards a massive blood ritual. He has all but locked away any tools that could be used to defeat him, and the scholars worry he is just beginning. A greater threat is about to befall the land...

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Ogre
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

WHAT IS AN OGRE?
A cruel thing, made from hateful men who desire dominion and tyranny over empathy and community. Their blood grows thick, their eyes bulge, their teeth turn to fangs and their tongue can cast forth only terrible words. These are not the boorish brutes of yonder hill, they are the dread landlord, the merciless lord of the manor, the hateful general, or the dark master of the borderland fortress.

They possess wealth beyond reckoning, but to hold such treasures is to risk falling to that which turns men into Ogres. Grift and Galgenbeck have their fair share of Ogres, isolated in their enclaves; and more than a few hamlets upon the shrouded roads of the dying world are held in such bitter clutches of avarice and wrath.

Created for FÖLK-LORE, a jam of MÖRK BORG content inspired by the folk legends of the world.

boardgame.name: Smarts & Guts
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

A quick to start "Lasers & Feelings" hack, set in the 1920's, where you and your crew explore underground mysteries, discover forgotten secrets and find signs of ancient beings. Without your leader and most of your original supplies, you'll not only have to fulfill your mission with what you have left but most importantly you'll have to survive.

boardgame.name: Girts & Girders
boardgame.description:
Roll & write game for two players in 30 minutes where you build railroad bridges. The players take turns in casting and selecting dice combinations by which they can either build new parts for bridges or create demand between cities looking to cross those bridges. The player that first finishes a given bridge gets the points for all traffic passing over it.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Gloom Chronicles
boardgame.description:
Take a journey through the miserable world of GLOOM!

In Gloom, you and your friends weave tales of woe. But where does the story begin? Each of the twenty cards in The Gloom Chronicles sets a unique foundation for a game of Gloom, and variant rules add new challenges to the story. You can choose a card at random, or you can start at the beginning and explore the ongoing fate of your family through an extended campaign. Your story begins with the Unhappy Birthday… but will your next game of Gloom involve a tragic train ride, or will you end up at the infamous World’s Unfair?

The Gloom Chronicles is an expansion that can enhance any game of Gloom. Narrative prompts give players a unified foundation for their stories, while variant rules challenge new and experienced players alike. The Unhappy Birthday awaits: where will your Gloom Chronicle end?

—description from the publisher
